analyzed: ha cang thung ngur ma yin /

analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do //

original: rab 'byor / de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni nam yang lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du mi skye'o //🔽de'ang thabs la mkhas pa 'di yin te /

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa gang dang ldan na /

analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la snyoms par 'jug kyang de'i dbang gis kyang mi skye ste /

translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who have the skillful means that is taught in this deep perfection of wisdom🔽enter into and rise up from all the meditative stabilities, immeasurable aspirations, and formless absorptions,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams yongs su dag par 'gyur te /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /

analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis de mi shes pas /

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni chos thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa nyid rjes su 'thob cing / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattva great beings who train like that attain the buddha strengths and fearlessnesses with regard to all dharmas.🔽They do not fall to the śrāvaka level

translated: Therefore, Subhūti, there are many more persons in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.🔽“Subhūti, those persons in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who practice this deep perfection of wisdom without doubt will enter into the irreversible level.🔽Those who do not practice without doubt will not enter into the irreversible level from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”🔽“Subhūti, those persons in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who practice this deep perfection of wisdom without doubt will enter into the irreversible level.

original: gang dag the tshom med pa des spyod par mi 'gyur ba dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag the tshom med pa des spyod par mi 'gyur ba dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not practice without doubt will not enter into the irreversible level from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'jug par 'dod pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i grangs su chud par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //

translated: Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who want to enter the irreversible level and who want to be counted among the irreversible should train in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa ni nam yang ser sna'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa ni nam yang ser sna'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom never develop a miserly mind.

original: nam yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi sems dang / le lo'i @291b sems dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi sems mi bskyed do //

translated: They never develop a mind of faulty morality, a mind of laziness, a mind of distraction, or a mind of faulty wisdom.

original: nam yang 'dod pa 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nam yang 'dod pa 'dod chags kyi sems dang / zhe sdang gi sems dang / gti mug dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: They never develop a mind of desire, a mind of anger, or a mind of delusion.

analyzed: nam yang 'khrul pa'i sems dang / bag med pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He never gives rise to a confused mind or a careless mind.

original: nam yang gzugs dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nam yang gzugs dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He never gives rise to a mind that is associated with form.

original: nam yang tshor ba dang ldan pa dang / 'du shes dang ldan pa dang / 'du byed rnams dang ldan pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /

translated: He never gives rise to a mind that is associated with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: nam yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang ldan pa'i sems dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang ldan pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nam yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang ldan pa'i sems dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang ldan pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: In the same way, he never gives rise to a mind that is associated with the perfection of generosity, up to a mind that is associated with the perfection of wisdom, up to a mind that is associated with the applications of mindfulness.

original: nam yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa dang / byang chub dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: nam yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang ldan pa dang / byang chub dang ldan pa'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He never gives rise to a mind that is associated with the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to a mind that is associated with enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na /🔽chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa na / chos gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because when those bodhisattva great beings practice this deep perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not see or apprehend any dharma at all.

original: mi dmigs pas chos gang la'ang sems bskyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas chos gang la'ang sems bskyed par mi byed do //
translated: Because they do not apprehend anything, they do not arouse their minds to any dharma.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yang dag @292a *//🔽par bzung ba yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yang dag @292a *// par bzung ba yin /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings practicing this deep perfection of wisdom take up all the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad gsal bar byas pa yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad gsal bar byas pa yin /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyang de dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are endowed with all the perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because all the perfections are included in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i nang du lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis 'dus pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'dus so //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, all the perfections are included in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

analyzed: mi 'chi ba'i dus byas pa'i srog gi dbang po 'gags pa na /
translated: when the life faculty ceases in a person at the time of death,

analyzed: dbang po thams cad 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the faculties cease.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po thams cad 'dus te /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, all the five perfections are included in this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na /
translated: Subhūti, if there were no perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: 'di thams cad pha rol tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: all of these would not be perfections.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bslab par bya'o //

analyzed: mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na / snying po dmigs pa'am /
translated: it is because bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not apprehend and do not see even insubstantiality.

original: mthong bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mthong bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could they apprehend or see substantiality?

original: snying po med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: snying po med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs shing /
translated: They do not apprehend and do not see even the insubstantial perfection of wisdom, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nas /
translated: up to they do not see the real nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: snying po med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: snying po med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs shing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: up to they do not apprehend and do not see the knowledge of all aspects as having an essence.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du dmigs pa'am /
translated: up to they do not apprehend and do not see the perfection of wisdom.🔽up to they do not apprehend and do not see the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mthong bar lta ga la 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bar lta ga la 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How could they apprehend or see the perfection of wisdom, up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rab tu mang po dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rab tu mang po dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the many gods of the desire realm had this thought:

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur pa dang / ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la'ang spyod la don de la spyod pa na'ang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du ma byas pas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur pa dang / ji skad bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la'ang spyod la don de la spyod pa na'ang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du ma byas pas /
translated: daughters of a good family who have produced the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and who practice this deep perfection of wisdom as it has been taught, and while practicing this meaning do not actualize the very limit of reality,

original: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: the level of a śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par mi 'gyur ba de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa yin te /
translated: Those who do not remain in the stage of a pratyekabuddha are worthy of homage.

original: rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: For this reason, son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid 'di dag mngon sum du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid 'di dag mngon sum du mi byed pa de dag ni phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: those who do not actualize this sameness of all phenomena are worthy of homage.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽kye lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha de dag la 'di skad ces smras so // kye lha'i bu dag /
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to those gods, “O gods!

original: gang dge ba'i chos mnyam pa nyid @306b gang mngon sum du byas pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i chos mnyam pa nyid @306b gang mngon sum du byas pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: The sameness of virtuous qualities that is actualized, by which one remains in the stage of a śrāvaka or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos mnyam pa nyid 'di dag mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ngo mtshar gcig dka' ba byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos mnyam pa nyid 'di dag mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi ngo mtshar gcig dka' ba byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: the stage of a pratyekabuddha, is not actualized by those bodhisattvas. This is not a single marvel or difficult deed on the part of those bodhisattvas.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: O gods!

original: gang sems can 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med tshad med pa dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes go cha gyon par byed la /
analyzed: gang sems can 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med tshad med pa dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes go cha gyon par byed la /
translated: Those who don the armor, thinking, “I will lead to complete nirvāṇa countless, innumerable, immeasurable hundreds of thousands of sentient beings,”

original: gang dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i sems can de dag kyang shin tu mi dmigs pa ni de dag gi mchog tu dka' ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i sems can de dag kyang shin tu mi dmigs pa ni de dag gi mchog tu dka' ba byed pa yin te /
translated: and who do not apprehend those sentient beings who are to be led to complete nirvāṇa, they are the ones who are the most difficult to find.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems can thams cad gdul bar 'dod par sems te de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems can thams cad gdul bar 'dod par sems te de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs nas /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who think, “I will train all sentient beings,” and who, thinking like this, set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o snyam nas go cha bgos pa de dag ni nam mkha' gdul bar 'dod par sems pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gdul bar bya'o snyam nas go cha bgos pa de dag ni nam mkha' gdul bar 'dod par sems pa yin no //
translated: and who don the armor, thinking, “I will train all sentient beings,” they are the ones who think they will train space.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir sems can dben par blta bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can stong pa nyid du blta bar bya ba dang / nam mkha' snying po med pa'i phyir sems can snying po med pa nyid du blta bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir sems can dben par blta bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du nam mkha' stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can stong pa nyid du blta bar bya ba dang / nam mkha' snying po med pa'i phyir sems can snying po med pa nyid du blta bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because space is insubstantial, sentient beings should be seen as insubstantial.

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang yod pa ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyi ched du snying rje chen po'i go cha gyon @307a *//
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / rnam grangs des kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang yod pa ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyi ched du snying rje chen po'i go cha gyon @307a *//
translated: Divine princes,

original: pa rnams ni dka' ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pa rnams ni dka' ba byed pa yin no //
translated: for these reasons, bodhisattva great beings who don the great armor for the sake of sentient beings who do not exist are performing a difficult feat.

original: gang zhig sems can rnams kyi ched du snying rje chen po'i go cha bgo bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' dang 'thab par 'dod du zad de /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can rnams kyi ched du snying rje chen po'i go cha bgo bar sems pa de ni nam mkha' dang 'thab par 'dod du zad de /
translated: Those who don the great armor for the sake of sentient beings are like those who wish to fight with space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha bgos pa des ni gang dag gi don du go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha bgos pa des ni gang dag gi don du go cha bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: “The bodhisattva great being who has donned the armor does not apprehend those sentient beings for whose sake he has donned the armor.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar sems can dben pa'i phyir go cha dben par blta bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can dben pa'i phyir go cha dben par blta bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the armor should be seen as being isolated because sentient beings are isolated.

original: gal te de skad bshad pa na /
analyzed: gal te de skad bshad pa na /
translated: If, when this is being taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi zhum zhing kun tu mi zhum na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi zhum zhing kun tu mi zhum na /
translated: the bodhisattva great being does not become cowed, does not become stolid,

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: then he is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar gzugs dben pa gang yin pa de sems can dben pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa gang yin pa de sems can dben pa nyid yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dben pa gang yin pa de sems can dben pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa gang yin pa de sems can dben pa nyid yin pa dang /
translated: Because the isolation of form is the isolation of sentient beings, and similarly, the isolation of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the isolation of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa drug dben pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dben pa nyid du bstan pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa drug dben pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir ro // gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad dben pa nyid du bstan pa na /
translated: Similarly, the emptiness of form, the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of perception, the emptiness of volitional factors, and the emptiness of consciousness are the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems mi zhum mi 'gong zhing mi skrag mi dngang la dngang bar mi 'gyur @307b na; de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems mi zhum mi 'gong zhing mi skrag mi dngang la dngang bar mi 'gyur @307b na; de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: If bodhisattva great beings, when this is being taught, do not feel disheartened, do not feel elated, do not tremble, are not frightened, and are not terrified, then they are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: “Subhūti, why do bodhisattva great beings not get discouraged about this deep perfection of wisdom?”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Lord!

original: chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: Because all phenomena do not exist,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur ba lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur ba lags so //
translated: bodhisattva great beings do not get discouraged about this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad dben pa'i slad du dang / zhi ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad dben pa'i slad du dang / zhi ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, because all phenomena are void, and because they are calm, bodhisattva great beings do not get discouraged about this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Lord!

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhum par mi 'gyur lags so //
translated: For that reason, bodhisattva great beings do not get discouraged about this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?”

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di ltar gang dag gis zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / 'di ltar gang dag gis zhum par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,🔽it is because all phenomena, those by which one might become fainthearted,

original: gang zhig zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang du zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: gang zhig zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang du zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: those by which one might become fainthearted, and those in which one might become fainthearted, are not apprehended.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: gal te de skad bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgyid lug pa ma mchis shing /🔽mi zhum mi 'gong kun tu mi 'gong ste /
analyzed: gal te de skad bshad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgyid lug pa ma mchis shing / mi zhum mi 'gong kun tu mi 'gong ste /
translated: if a bodhisattva great being is not fainthearted when this is explained,🔽and does not become fainthearted, does not become timid, does not become cowed,

original: mi skrag mi dngang la dngang bar mi 'gyur @308a *//
analyzed: mi skrag mi dngang la dngang bar mi 'gyur @308a *//
translated: does not tremble, does not become frightened, and does not become terrified,

original: na; de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: na; de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa lags so //
translated: then they are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gang zhig zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang du zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis zhum par 'gyur ba dang / gang du zhum par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: It is because all those phenomena, those by which one might become fainthearted, those by which one might become fainthearted, and those in which one might become fainthearted, are not apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa la ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams rtag tu phyag bgyid lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa la ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams rtag tu phyag bgyid lags so //
translated: The gods together with Indra, the gods together with Brahmā, and the gods together with the Lord of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin gods always pay homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa la ni /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa la ni /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams nyi tshes rtag tu phyag byed par 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa'i lha rnams dang / skye dgu'i bdag po dang bcas pa'i lha rnams nyi tshes rtag tu phyag byed par 'gyur bar ma zad kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, the gods together with Indra, the gods together with Brahmā, and the gods together with the Lord of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin gods not only always pay homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: rab 'byor / mngon par 'phags pa'i lha 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mngon par 'phags pa'i lha 'di lta ste /
translated: but also, Subhūti, the gods who are superior, namely,

analyzed: dge rgyas pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i lha gang dag yin ba de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa la rtag tu phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
translated: and the gods of the Pure Abodes, constantly pay homage to those bodhisattva great beings who practice this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / phyogs bcu'i 'jig @308b rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med tshad med pa dag na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyogs bcu'i 'jig @308b rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med tshad med pa dag na /
translated: Subhūti, in the world systems of the ten directions,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs shing gzhes la chos ston pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa 'di ni /
translated: those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas who are present, live happily, and teach the Dharma, they too,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: will complete the perfection of concentration.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: In the same way, they will perfect the transcendent perfection of generosity, and so on, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la rtag tu dgongs par mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la rtag tu dgongs par mdzad do //
translated: they will perfect the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs par gzung bar bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gal te 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs par gzung bar bya'o // rab 'byor / gal te 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: should be understood to have entered into buddhahood.🔽Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River were to become Māra the wicked one,

original: sems can ji snyed yod pa de snyed bdud sdig can du gyur la /
analyzed: sems can ji snyed yod pa de snyed bdud sdig can du gyur la /
translated: and

original: bdud re res kyang bdud sdig can de snyed mngon par sprul te /

analyzed: brtson pa mi gtong bar sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: teaching the doctrine to sentient beings without giving up striving,

original: ci nas kyang sems can de dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'god par byed pa nas /
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems can de dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'god par byed pa nas /

analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la 'god par byed pa de lta de ltar chos ston par byed la /

original: ci nas kyang 'dus byas kyi khams la'ang mi 'god /
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'dus byas kyi khams la'ang mi 'god /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la'ang mi 'god pa de lta de ltar 'god par byed de /
translated: and they establish them in such a way that they do not settle down in the uncompounded element.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: take hold of the perfection of concentration?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, standing in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: except for the Tathāgata’s meditative stabilization, enter into all the other meditative stabilizations,🔽whether the śrāvaka meditative stabilizations,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams sam /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha meditative stabilizations,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad la snyoms par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad la snyoms par 'jug par byed do //
translated: or the bodhisattva meditative stabilizations.

original: de byang chub sems dpa'i @331b ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas /
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa'i @331b ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas /
translated: Standing in that bodhisattva meditative stabilization,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dag la lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po dag la lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ngo //
translated: they enter into and rise up from the eight liberations in forward and reverse order.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is when one with form sees forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: “With the perception of the inner body as absent, one sees external forms. This is the second liberation.

original: sdug par mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sdug par mos pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: “With the perception of beauty, one is intent on beauty. This is the third liberation.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: “Having completely transcended the perception of form, the cessation of the perception of obstruction,

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas /🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas / nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: and not paying attention to the perception of diversity,

analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //

original: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /🔽rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: “Having completely transcended the sphere of the infinity of space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //
translated: one perceives the infinity of consciousness and achieves and abides in the sphere of the infinity of consciousness. This is the fifth liberation.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In every way, they transcend the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci'ang med do snyam nas /
analyzed: ci'ang med do snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, “There is nothing at all,”

original: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: they accomplish and abide in the sphere of nothing whatsoever. This is the sixth liberation.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ci'ang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ci'ang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In every way, they transcend the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad du 'du @332a *//
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o // rnam pa thams cad du 'du @332a *//
translated: They accomplish and abide in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the seventh liberation.

original: shes mad 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: shes mad 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: In every way, they transcend the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: They accomplish and abide in the cessation of perception and feeling. This is the eighth liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po 'di dag la lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po 'di dag la lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ngo //
translated: They enter and arise from these eight liberations in forward and reverse order.

original: de bzhin du mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po dag la lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po dag la lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug cing ldang ngo //
translated: In the same way, he enters into and arises from the nine serial absorptions in forward order and reverse order.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ste dgu po de dag go /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ste dgu po de dag go /
translated: the four concentrations, the four formless absorptions, and the cessation of ideation and feeling.

original: de rnam par thar pa brgyad po de dag dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po de dag so sor phya nas /
analyzed: de rnam par thar pa brgyad po de dag dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu po de dag so sor phya nas /
translated: Having entered into and arisen from each of those eight liberations and those nine serial absorptions,

original: sengge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: sengge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: he enters the meditative absorption called the lion’s play.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sengge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sengge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ meditative absorption called the lion’s play?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, separated from desire,

analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the first concentration.

original: de bzhin du bde ba'ang spangs /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba'ang spangs /
translated: In the same way, he abandons happiness,

original: sdug @332b bsngal yang spangs nas /
analyzed: sdug @332b bsngal yang spangs nas /

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang snga nas nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang snga nas nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: he previously abandons joy and mental unhappiness, and dwells in equanimity, mindful and clearly comprehending.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the fourth concentration, which is neither suffering nor happiness, and is complete purity of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: In the same way, he enters into the concentration of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽Then, he enters into the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de nas 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug go; 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug go; 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas /
