analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: he enters into the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas /
translated: Having risen from the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: in the same vein,

original: bsam gtan dang po'i bar la snyoms par zhugs par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i bar la snyoms par zhugs par gnas pa ste /
translated: he enters into the first meditative concentration.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni sengge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni sengge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: Subhūti, this is the meditative stabilization called the lion’s play.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas /
translated: Dwelling in that meditative stabilization,

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: he attains the sameness of all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: Subhūti, in that way, when bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: they incorporate the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsdu ba'i le'u ste nyi shu bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsdu ba'i le'u ste nyi shu bdun pa'o ////
translated: the twenty-seventh chapter is called “The Summary of the Perfections.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽chos thams cad dbyer ma @333a *//
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / chos thams cad dbyer ma @333a *//
translated: “Lord,🔽since all phenomena are undifferentiated,

original: mchis shing mtshan ma ma mchis te /
analyzed: mchis shing mtshan ma ma mchis te /
translated: signless,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag sgom pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag sgom pa ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: and empty of their own marks, how can the perfection of the six perfections be fulfilled?

original: 'di dag ji ltar tha dad par gdags lags /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar tha dad par gdags lags /
translated: How are they designated as different?

original: chos 'di dag las tha dad du dbye ba ji ltar mchis lags /
analyzed: chos 'di dag las tha dad du dbye ba ji ltar mchis lags /
translated: How are they differentiated from these phenomena?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mchis lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus pa'i chos rnams la ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mchis lags /
translated: how is the perfection of generosity in the phenomena included in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de ltar gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de ltar gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, how is there the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ji ltar mchis lags /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ji ltar mchis lags /
translated: In the same way, how are there the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i chos thams cad la ji ltar mtshan nyid gcig par gdags par mdzad lags /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i chos thams cad la ji ltar mtshan nyid gcig par gdags par mdzad lags /
translated: how do you designate all phenomena that are without defining characteristics as having a single defining characteristic?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Transcendent Victor replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: “Su­bhūti, here great bodhisattva beings, practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: abiding in the five acquisitive psycho-physical aggregates which are dream-like,

original: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la @333b gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la @333b gnas te /
translated: Similarly, they stand in the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like a phantom,

original: sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams la sbyin pa sbyin par byed /
translated: and give gifts to sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed /
translated: Similarly, they guard morality,

original: bzod pa sgom par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa sgom par byed /
translated: cultivate tolerance,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: exert perseverance,

original: bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la snyoms par 'jug par byed /
translated: become absorbed in meditative concentration,

original: shes rab sgom par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab sgom par byed do //
translated: and cultivate wisdom.

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The five appropriating aggregates which are like a dream are without defining characteristics.

original: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, and like a phantom are without defining characteristics.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, if you ask why,

original: rmi lam la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med la /
analyzed: rmi lam la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med la /
translated: because dreams have no intrinsic reality whatsoever,

original: brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa la ni ngo bo nyid ci'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because echoes, optical aberrations, mirages, magical displays, and phantoms have no intrinsic reality whatsoever.

original: chos gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la ni mtshan nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: chos gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de la ni mtshan nyid kyang med do //
translated: Any dharma that has no intrinsic reality also has no defining mark.

original: gang la mtshan nyid med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la mtshan nyid med pa de ni /
translated: That which has no defining mark

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is, namely,

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig go /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig go /
translated: of one defining mark, i.e., no defining mark.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na rnam grangs des na /
translated: “Subhūti, for this reason

original: khyod kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / sbyin pa po'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / len pa po'i mtshan nyid med par de ltar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / sbyin pa po'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / len pa po'i mtshan nyid med par de ltar rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that the perfection of generosity is without defining mark, the one who gives is without defining mark, and the one who receives is without defining mark.”

original: gang gis de ltar shes nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar shes nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Whoever, knowing thus, gives a gift does not pass beyond the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa drug @334a *//🔽po 'di dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa drug @334a *// po 'di dag la gnas nas /
translated: Abiding in these six perfections,

original: bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: he perfects the four meditative concentrations.

original: de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Similarly, he perfects the four immeasurables and the four formless absorptions.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: In the same way, they perfect the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yongs su rdzogs par byed do // de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed do // de bzhin du phyi stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid nas /
translated: They perfect the three gateways to liberation.🔽In the same way, they perfect inner emptiness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the same way, they perfect outer emptiness, the emptiness of what is internal and external, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /🔽mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he perfects the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the five types of spiritual powers, the five hundred dhāraṇī gateways, the five hundred meditative absorption gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba /
translated: “He perfects those uncontaminated noble dharmas that arise from ripening.

original: 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos de dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i chos de dag la gnas nas /
translated: Abiding in those uncontaminated noble dharmas,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu @334b song nas /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu @334b song nas /
translated: he goes to as many world systems in the eastern direction as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: He serves the lord buddhas and

original: yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bkur sti byed do //
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bkur sti byed do //
translated: honors them with all articles of worship.

original: rtag tu sems can thams cad kyi don yang byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can thams cad kyi don yang byed do //
translated: And they always work for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas sdud par byed do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag sbyin pas bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni sbyin pas sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be guided by generosity, they gather in with generosity.

original: gang dag tshul khrims dang / gang dag bzod pa dang / gang dag brtson 'grus dang / gang dag bsam gtan dang / gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni shes rab kyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: gang dag tshul khrims dang / gang dag bzod pa dang / gang dag brtson 'grus dang / gang dag bsam gtan dang / gang dag shes rab kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni shes rab kyis sdud par byed do //
translated: Those who are to be guided by morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, they gather in with wisdom.

original: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis sdud par byed de /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis bsdu bar bya ba de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis sdud par byed de /
translated: Those who are to be guided by all the roots of virtue, they gather in with all the roots of virtue.

original: chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba len par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba len par byed mod kyi /
translated: They take on saṃsāra, being endowed with mastery over all phenomena.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pas kyang mi gos so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pas kyang mi gos so //
translated: And yet they are not sullied by the faults of saṃsāra.

original: sems can rnams kyi ched du lha dang mi rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dag 'dzin cing len par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ched du lha dang mi rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dag 'dzin cing len par byed de /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they take on and hold the excellence of gods and humans.

original: de dag dang ldan pas sems can de dag bsdu pa'i dngos po dag gis sdud par byed la /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pas sems can de dag bsdu pa'i dngos po dag gis sdud par byed la /
translated: Endowed with these, they gather beings with the means of gathering.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par yang dag par shes nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par yang dag par shes nas /
translated: Having understood that all phenomena are without defining characteristics,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par bya'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par bya'o snyam du sems te /
translated: they think, ‘I will attain the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par shes nas /
translated: Subhūti, in this way, bodhisattva great beings, having understood that all phenomena are without defining characteristics,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /🔽rmi lam lta @335a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni / rmi lam lta @335a *//
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: while standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: complete the perfection of morality.

original: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /
translated: Similarly, they stand in the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a magical creation, like a mirage, like a phantom,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and perfect the perfection of morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag shes nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag shes nas /
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings, having understood the five appropriating aggregates which are like a dream,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do; ;de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag shes nas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do; ;de bzhin du brag ca lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag shes nas /
translated: perfect the perfection of morality which has no mark. Similarly, having understood the five appropriating aggregates which are like an echo, like an optical aberration, like a mirage, like a magical creation, like a phantom,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma nyams pa dang / skyon med pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / nag nog med pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma nyams pa dang / skyon med pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / nag nog med pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / dbang 'byor pa dang / mkhas pas bsngags pa dang /
translated: The perfection of morality is unimpaired, faultless, unadulterated, unblemished, unpreoccupied, mastered, praised by the wise,

original: shin tu rdzogs pa dang / shin tu legs par blangs pa dang / 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: shin tu rdzogs pa dang / shin tu legs par blangs pa dang / 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i lam du gtogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: fully complete, fully taken up, and fully perfected by the noble ones on the undefiled path.

original: de la gnas nas yang dag par blang ba; brda can gyi tshul khrims srung bar byed do //
analyzed: de la gnas nas yang dag par blang ba; brda can gyi tshul khrims srung bar byed do //
translated: Abiding in that, one observes the morality of taking up what is right and the morality of avoiding what is wrong.

original: de bzhin du chos nyid kyis thob pa dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims dang / kun tu spyod pa'i tshul khrims @335b srung bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos nyid kyis thob pa dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang bcas pa'i tshul khrims dang / kun tu spyod pa'i tshul khrims @335b srung bar byed do //
translated: Similarly, one observes the morality of obtaining by nature, the morality of restraint, and the morality of conduct.

original: de tshul khrims de lta bu dang ldan yang tshul khrims 'dis bdag rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: de tshul khrims de lta bu dang ldan yang tshul khrims 'dis bdag rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: Even though they have such morality, they think, “By this morality may I be reborn with the good fortune of a great sāla tree-like royal family

original: de bzhin du bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang / khyim bdag shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: or a great sāla tree-like brahmin family or a great sāla tree-like householder family.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims 'dis bdag khams kyi rgyal por gyur cig ce'am /🔽de bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi pa'i bdag por gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims 'dis bdag khams kyi rgyal por gyur cig ce'am / de bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi pa'i bdag por gyur cig ce'am /
translated: By this morality may I become a king of a region.🔽By this morality may I become a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims 'dis bdag rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims 'dis bdag rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: By this morality may I be reborn with the good fortune of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig ce'am /
translated: In the same way, may I be reborn with the same fortune as the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, the gods of the Heaven of Joy, the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims 'dis bdag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims 'dis bdag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: In the same way, through this morality, may I attain the fruit of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: the fruit of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub nyid kyi 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rang byang chub nyid kyi 'bras bu'am /
translated: the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'am /
translated: the acceptance of the bodhisattvas,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob par gyur cig snyam du chos gang la'ang mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob par gyur cig snyam du chos gang la'ang mchog tu 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: and the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thams cad la shin tu brtan par gnas pa'i phyir @336a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos thams cad la shin tu brtan par gnas pa'i phyir @336a *//
translated: It is because they are firmly grounded in all phenomena that are devoid of marks.

original: te; mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos mi 'thob cing /
analyzed: te; mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i chos mi 'thob cing /
translated: “A phenomenon without marks does not attain a phenomenon without marks,

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos mi thob la; mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos mi 'thob cing /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos mi thob la; mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos mi 'thob cing /
translated: and a phenomenon with different marks does not attain a phenomenon with different marks, and a phenomenon without marks does not attain a phenomenon with different marks,

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i chos kyis kyang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos mi 'thob ste /
translated: and a phenomenon with different marks does not attain a phenomenon without marks.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas shing /
translated: complete the perfection of morality without marks

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas /
translated: and enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: They attain the acceptance of dharmas not arising.

original: de nas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga 'thob bo //
analyzed: de nas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga 'thob bo //
translated: Then they attain the five superknowledges that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya'ang 'thob cing /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo lnga brgya dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya'ang 'thob cing /
translated: He will also attain the five hundred dhāraṇī gateways and the five hundred samādhi gateways.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'ang 'thob bo //
translated: He will also attain the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: Then he will serve the blessed buddhas

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: and bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la /
translated: He will also purify a buddhafield

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
translated: and travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: de nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na rgyu mod kyi /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na rgyu mod kyi /
translated: Then, although he will be wandering in the five realms of cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba'i skyon rnams kyis kyang mi gos so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon rnams kyis kyang mi gos so //
translated: he will not be tainted by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: dper na / sprul pa'i skyes bu ni 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'chag pa dang / nyal @336b par yang byed mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / sprul pa'i skyes bu ni 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'chag pa dang / nyal @336b par yang byed mod kyi /
translated: For example, an emanated person may stand, sit, walk, lie down,

original: las kyi yon tan dang / skyon de dag gis kyang mi gos la /
analyzed: las kyi yon tan dang / skyon de dag gis kyang mi gos la /
translated: and so forth, but he is not tainted by the good qualities or faults of his actions.

original: sems can gyi don yang byed de /
analyzed: sems can gyi don yang byed de /
translated: He also benefits sentient beings.

original: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: and he does not apprehend a sentient being or the designation of a sentient being.

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu zhi ba zhes bya bas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu zhi ba zhes bya bas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas /
translated: For example, a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, named Śānta, turned the wheel of the Dharma,

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par bya ba 'ga' yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par bya ba 'ga' yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and he did not apprehend anyone at all to be predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de sprul pa zhig mngon par sprul nas /🔽tshe'i 'du byed rnams btang ste /
analyzed: de sprul pa zhig mngon par sprul nas / tshe'i 'du byed rnams btang ste /
translated: He emanated an emanation

original: phung po'i lhag ngon par sprul nas /🔽tshe'i 'du byed rnams btang ste /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ngon par sprul nas / tshe'i 'du byed rnams btang ste /
translated: and, having given up the compositional factors of life,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: he passed into parinirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can dang / sems can du gdags pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, although a bodhisattva great being does not apprehend a sentient being or the designation of a sentient being,

original: sems can rnams kyi don yang byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don yang byed de /
translated: he does work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do;; ;;'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /

original: bam po nyi shu brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu brgyad pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, the bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas /
translated: dwelling in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a dream,

original: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu @337a *//
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas / bzod pa'i pha rol tu @337a *//
translated: dwelling in the five appropriating aggregates that are like an emanation,

original: phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: perfects the perfection of patience.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnyis kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de /🔽gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnyis kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de / gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: Subhuti: Here the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of patience, fulfils the perfection of patience.🔽And how does he fulfil the perfection of patience?🔽There are two kinds of patience: the patience of acquiescence and the patience of toleration.

original: dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos rtogs pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽de la dang du len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos rtogs pa'i bzod pa'o // de la dang du len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni / gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: What is the patience of acquiescence?🔽From the first thought of enlightenment onwards the Bodhisattva, the great being, should acquiesce in the fact that all dharmas are not produced, that they are calm from the beginning, that they are essentially empty, that they are isolated.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la gal te sems can thams cad lhags te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la gal te sems can thams cad lhags te /
translated: Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?

original: tshig ngan pa dag gis spyos shing brgyad bkag gam /
analyzed: tshig ngan pa dag gis spyos shing brgyad bkag gam /
translated: Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?

original: bong ba'am / dbyug pa'am /
analyzed: bong ba'am / dbyug pa'am /
translated: Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?

original: mtshon cha'am / lag cha dag gis bsnun na'ang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa des /
analyzed: mtshon cha'am / lag cha dag gis bsnun na'ang gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa des /
translated: Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.🔽And why?🔽Because all dharmas are essentially empty.

original: 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'am /
translated: And

original: gnod sems dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam yang bskyed par mi bya bar sems can de dag nyid la /
analyzed: gnod sems dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam yang bskyed par mi bya bar sems can de dag nyid la /
translated: They should not give rise to even the slightest thought of ill will.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis gzir ba dag ste /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis gzir ba dag ste /
translated: They should think, “Alas! These sentient beings are afflicted by the illness of the afflictions.

original: lhag par snying rje bya zhing bdag gis sdig pa can gyi sems ni bskyed par mi bya'i /
analyzed: lhag par snying rje bya zhing bdag gis sdig pa can gyi sems ni bskyed par mi bya'i /
translated: I should have special compassion for them. I should not give rise to a sinful mind.

original: bdag nyid kyis dgrar gyur ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag bzung bar zad do snyam du de ltar so sor rtog cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dgrar gyur ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag bzung bar zad do snyam du de ltar so sor rtog cing /
translated: I have taken up these five appropriated aggregates, which are my enemies.”

original: byams pa dang / snying rje byed na /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje byed na /
translated: When they think in this way, and when they act with love and compassion,

original: de ni dang du len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dang du len pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called “the patience of accepting suffering.”

original: chos rtogs pa la bzod pa @337b gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rtogs pa la bzod pa @337b gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the patience of being tolerant of the Dharma?

original: ji ltar yod pa de dag kyang don dam par mi dmigs na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa de dag kyang don dam par mi dmigs na /
translated: Since they do not apprehend anything ultimately,

original: 'di la su zhig bdag la tshig ngan pa dag gis gshe bar byed pa'am /🔽brgyad bkag par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la su zhig bdag la tshig ngan pa dag gis gshe bar byed pa'am / brgyad bkag par byed pa'am /
translated: who is there who would revile me with verbal abuse?🔽Who would obstruct me?

original: su zhig bdag la dbyug pas brdeg par byed /
analyzed: su zhig bdag la dbyug pas brdeg par byed /
translated: Who would strike me with a weapon?

original: mtshon gyis 'debs par byed /
analyzed: mtshon gyis 'debs par byed /
translated: They are struck with weapons.

original: lcag gis gzhu bar byed de /
analyzed: lcag gis gzhu bar byed de /
translated: They are whipped.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: All formations are like an illusion,

original: gsog dang / gsob dang / ya ma brla dang / nam mkha' lta bu dag yin te /
analyzed: gsog dang / gsob dang / ya ma brla dang / nam mkha' lta bu dag yin te /
translated: empty, hollow, void, and like space.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / skye ba po dang / srog dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang bral ba dag yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / skye ba po dang / srog dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang bral ba dag yin la /
translated: They are devoid of a self, a sentient being, a life-force, an individual, a human being, a human, and a person.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: All thoughts are false

original: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba yin na /🔽'di la su zhig bdag la gshe ba'am /
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las byung ba yin na / 'di la su zhig bdag la gshe ba'am /
translated: and arise from conceptualization.🔽So who is there to revile me

original: bsnan par byed de /🔽bdag gis ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bsnan par byed de / bdag gis ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: or to insult me?

original: de ltar rnam par brtag par mi bya'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par brtag par mi bya'o snyam du sems na /
translated: I should not think in this way because of the emptiness of inherent existence and the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽’

original: de ni chos rtogs pa la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni chos rtogs pa la bzod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the acceptance of the realization of phenomena.

original: bzod pa de gnyis la sgom zhing nye bar rtog la /
analyzed: bzod pa de gnyis la sgom zhing nye bar rtog la /
translated: One should cultivate and contemplate these two acceptances.

original: rnam par dpyod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob la /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob la /
translated: “Investigation” means to attain acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: And one also perfects the perfection of patience.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to; ;btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Reverend Lord!

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni ji lta bu lags /
translated: What is acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas like?

original: 'di'i tshad ni ci tsam zhig lags /
analyzed: 'di'i tshad ni ci tsam zhig lags /
translated: What is its measure?

original: 'di'i shes pa ni gang lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom @338a *//
analyzed: 'di'i shes pa ni gang lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom @338a *//
translated: What is its knowledge?

original: ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Reverend Lord!

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la sdig pa can gyi chos rdul tsam yang mi skye zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la sdig pa can gyi chos rdul tsam yang mi skye zhing /
translated: No bad dharmas, not even the smallest, arise in that bodhisattva great being.

original: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa'ang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: de la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa'ang mi 'byung la /
translated: And in that there is no appropriation of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: rmi lam lta bu'i 'du byed thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzod pa dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi 'du byed thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzod pa thob ste /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i 'du byed thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzod pa dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bar gyi 'du byed thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bzod pa thob ste /
translated: “They have the acceptance of all compounded things being like a dream, and they have the acceptance of all compounded things being like an emanation.

original: des na de ni mi skye ba la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na de ni mi skye ba la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the acceptance of non-arising.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽nyan thos kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa gang lags pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa gsum po 'di dag la khyad par ram /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / nyan thos kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa gang lags pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gang lags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gang lags pa'i bzod pa gsum po 'di dag la khyad par ram /
translated: “Lord,

original: tha dad du bgyi pa ci mchis lags /
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi pa ci mchis lags /
translated: what is the difference between these three acceptances—the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise of śrāvakas, the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise of pratyekabuddhas, and the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise of bodhisattvas?”🔽“Subhūti, the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise of śrāvakas is one thing, the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise of pratyekabuddhas is another, and the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise of bodhisattvas is another.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord, how much merit will a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, and properly pays attention to it produce?

original: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rgyun du zhugs pa'i shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, the knowledge and abandonment of a stream enterer is a bodhisattva great being’s forbearance.

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i gang yin pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i shes pa dang / @338b spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i gang yin pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i shes pa dang / @338b spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge and abandonment of a once-returner, a non-returner, and an arhat is a bodhisattva great being’s forbearance.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa dang / spong ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The knowledge and abandonment of a pratyekabuddha is a bodhisattva great being’s forbearance.

original: nyan thos kyi bzod pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bzod pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bzod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: That is the difference between the forbearance of a śrāvaka, the forbearance of a pratyekabuddha, and the forbearance of a bodhisattva.”🔽“Subhūti, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, and properly pays attention to it produces a lot of merit.

original: tha dad du dbye ba ni de yin no //
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba ni de yin no //
translated: This is the division into different types.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa de lta bu de dang ldan pa de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa de lta bu de dang ldan pa de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who has such patience surpasses all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bzod pa de la gnas nas /
analyzed: de bzod pa de la gnas nas /
translated: Abiding in that patience,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: he perfects the knowledge of path aspects.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid de dang ldan na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga dang yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid de dang ldan na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / de bzhin du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa lnga dang yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with that knowledge of path aspects, he does not lack the thirty-seven factors of awakening, and similarly, he does not lack the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations, and the five clairvoyances that arise from the ripening of karma.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la'ang bsnyen bkur byed la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la'ang bsnyen bkur byed la /
translated: Endowed with these superknowledges, he goes from buddhafield to buddhafield, and serves and honors the buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: yo byad thams cad kyis bkur sti byed cing /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis bkur sti byed cing /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: and enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: gsol pa / @341b btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / @341b btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord, what is a bodhisattva’s flaw?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ni gang lags /🔽skyon ma mchis pa ni gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ni gang lags / skyon ma mchis pa ni gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is a bodhisattva’s secure state?”

original: rab 'byor / dmigs pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / dmigs pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon yin no //
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti, all objective supports are a bodhisattva’s flaw.

original: dmigs pa med pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no //🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no // gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The absence of a reference point is the bodhisattvas’ flawlessness.

original: dmigs pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gang lags /
translated: Subhūti then asked, “Lord, what is a reference point?

original: dmigs pa ma mchis pa ni gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa ma mchis pa ni gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is the absence of a reference point?”

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Subhūti, form is a reference point for bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, likewise, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are reference points for bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'o; ;de bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'o; ;de bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are reference points for bodhisattva great beings. Likewise, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are reference points for bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang byang chub sems dpa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, are the bodhisattva’s objects of observation.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni gang la chos de dag rgyu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni gang la chos de dag rgyu ba med pa ste /
translated: The absence of an object of observation is where those phenomena do not move.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gang la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang /🔽sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams dang / de bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs @342a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gang la gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams dang / de bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs @342a *//
translated: It is like this:🔽where there is no form, no feeling, no conception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness, and similarly, no eyes, no ears, no nose, no tongue, no body, and no thinking mind, and similarly, no form,

original: kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / de bzhin du rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: no sound, no smell, no taste, no tangible, and no dharmas, and similarly, no eye constituent, no form constituent, and no eye consciousness constituent, and similarly, no ear constituent, no sound constituent, and no ear consciousness constituent, no nose constituent, no smell constituent, and no nose consciousness constituent,

original: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: the tongue element, the tastes element, and the tongue consciousness element, the body element, the tangibles element, and the body consciousness element, the thinking-mind element, the dharma element, and the thinking-mind consciousness element,

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: similarly, the four applications of mindfulness, and in the same way

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
translated: up to the eightfold noble path, and similarly, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same way

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos de dag dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos de dag dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and similarly, up to the knowledge of all aspects, those dharmas are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod du med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod du med la /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of physical forms is inexpressible,🔽and so on up to🔽the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects is inexpressible.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i gang yin pa dang / 'du shes kyi gang yin pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod du med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i gang yin pa dang / 'du shes kyi gang yin pa dang / 'du byed rnams kyi gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod du med do //
translated: In the same way, the essence of feeling, the essence of perception, the essence of volitional factors, and the essence of consciousness cannot be described.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod du med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod du med pa'i phyir te /
translated: the essence of , up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, cannot be described.

original: bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: They perfect all the meditative stabilities and the meditative concentrations,

original: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skyen /
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skyen /
translated: but they are not reborn by the power of those meditative stabilities and meditative concentrations.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis skye bar lta ci @342b smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis skye bar lta ci @342b smos te /
translated: How could they be reborn by the power of desire, hatred, or delusion?

original: de ni gnas med do //🔽skye ba gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: de ni gnas med do // skye ba gang la gnas nas /
translated: There is no such basis.

original: las gang dag mngon par 'dus byas pas /
analyzed: las gang dag mngon par 'dus byas pas /
translated: They are reborn in whatever way is necessary to bring sentient beings to🔽maturity,

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar ltung ba'i las rnams mngon par 'du byed pa de ni gnas med de /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar ltung ba'i las rnams mngon par 'du byed pa de ni gnas med de /
translated: but they do not perform any action that would cause them to fall into the five realms of existence.🔽There is no such basis.

original: gzhan du na sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du byed rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnas nas /
analyzed: gzhan du na sgyu ma lta bu'i 'du byed rnams la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnas nas /
translated: Otherwise, even with regard to illusion-like formations,

original: rtag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed mod kyi /
analyzed: rtag tu sems can rnams kyi don byed mod kyi /
translated: they would always be acting for the welfare of sentient beings, having remained in the real just as it is.

original: sems can ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems can ngo bo nyid kyis mi dmigs /
translated: But sentient beings are not perceived in terms of their intrinsic reality,

original: sgyu ma'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sgyu ma'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: and even illusions are not perceived.

original: des sems can dang / sgyu ma mi dmigs pas sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: des sems can dang / sgyu ma mi dmigs pas sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: And through not perceiving sentient beings and illusions, they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: And they refine the buddhafields.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, in this way bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas / 'di lta ste /
translated: having perfected the perfection of meditative stability,🔽turn the wheel of the Dharma,

original: dmigs su med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i rab tu skor bar byed do //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i rab tu skor bar byed do //
translated: which is the wheel of the Dharma that cannot be apprehended.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag nas /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag nas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are like an echo,

original: sprul pa'i bar lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas /🔽chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nas /
analyzed: sprul pa'i bar lta bu'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la gnas nas / chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nas /
translated: standing in the five appropriating aggregates that are like a magical creation,

original: chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: know all dharmas as they really are, as like an echo, as like an apparition, up to as like a magical creation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti asked the Lord,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /🔽ji ltar chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nas /🔽chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yang dag pa ji @343a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na / ji ltar chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu nas / chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu'i bar du yang dag pa ji @343a *//
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: lta ba bzhin du yongs su 'chal ba lags /
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du yongs su 'chal ba lags /
translated: know all dharmas as they really are, as like an echo, as like an apparition, up to as like a magical creation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
translated: are not dreamers of dreams,

original: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they dream-dreamers.

original: brag ca thos pa ma yin /
analyzed: brag ca thos pa ma yin /
translated: They are not hearers of echoes,

original: brag ca nyan pa po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: brag ca nyan pa po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they echo-hearers.

original: mig yor mthong ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mig yor mthong ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They are not viewers of optical illusions,

original: mig yor mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mig yor mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they optical-illusion-viewers.

original: de bzhin du smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa mthong ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, they are not viewers of mirages, magical displays, or emanations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rmi lam dang / de bzhin du brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam dang / de bzhin du brag ca dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phyin ci log yin te /
translated: Because dreams, and similarly echoes, optical illusions, mirages, magical displays, and emanations are the errors of foolish ordinary beings.

original: rab 'byor / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, worthy ones whose defilements have ceased are not dreamers of dreams,

original: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they dream-dreamers.

original: de bzhin du sprul pa mthong ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul pa mthong ba'ang ma yin /
translated: Similarly, they are not viewers of emanations,🔽nor are they emanation-viewers.

original: sprul pa mthong ba po'i bar du ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba po'i bar du ma yin zhing /
translated: up to the one who sees the emanation is not a dream,

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rmi lam rmi ba ma yin /
translated: and similarly, a pratyekabuddha, a bodhisattva, and a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha is not a dream,

original: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin la /🔽sprul pa mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: rmi lam rmi ba po'ang ma yin la / sprul pa mthong ba ma yin /
translated: and the one who dreams a dream is not a dream,🔽up to the one who sees the emanation is not a dream,

original: sprul pa mthong ba po'i bar du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa mthong ba po'i bar du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the one who sees the emanation is not a dream.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni yongs su ma grub pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar chos thams cad ni yongs su ma grub pa /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because all things are uncreated,

original: yang dag par ma byung ba yin na /
analyzed: yang dag par ma byung ba yin na /
translated: and they are not real.

original: de byang chub sems @343b dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dngos po'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ba'am /🔽yongs su grub pa'i 'du shes can nam /
analyzed: de byang chub sems @343b dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dngos po'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ba'am / yongs su grub pa'i 'du shes can nam /
translated: How could great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom have the notion that things are real,🔽or have the notion that they are fully developed,

original: yang dag par byung ba'i 'du shes can nam /🔽yang dag pa'i 'du shes can du lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par byung ba'i 'du shes can nam /🔽yang dag pa'i 'du shes can du lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: or have the notion that they are real,🔽or have the notion that they are true?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig gi ngo bo nyid dmigs sam /🔽de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'am /
analyzed: gal te chos 'ga' zhig gi ngo bo nyid dmigs sam / de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'am /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of some phenomenon were apprehended,🔽or if the thoroughly established nature,

original: yang dag par byung ba dmigs na /
analyzed: yang dag par byung ba dmigs na /
translated: or the perfectly arisen were apprehended,

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that would not be the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gzugs la mi chags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni gzugs la mi chags so //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in that way does not cling to form.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar la mi chags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar la mi chags so //
translated: Similarly, he does not cling to consciousness.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams la mi chags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams la mi chags so //
translated: Similarly, he does not cling to the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams la mi chags so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams la mi chags so //
translated: He does not cling to the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la mi chags so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la mi chags so //
translated: He does not cling to the formless realm.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la mi chags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la mi chags so //
translated: Similarly, he does not cling to all the meditative concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag la mi chags so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po dag la mi chags so //
translated: He does not cling to the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la mi chags so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la mi chags so //
translated: He does not get attached to the three gateways to liberation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mi chags so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la mi chags so //
translated: He does not get attached to the six perfections.

original: de sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: de sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: He perfects the first level,

original: de la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyang mi bskyed do //
